Why French politics can't cope without an absolute majority
description: While most European countries have learned to manage their fragmented parliaments, France has failed to adapt. The 'fait majoritaire,' the political dominance of a president backed by a parliamentary majority, has so deeply shaped politics since 1962 that lawmakers have been unable to envision governments built on a base of negotiation and compromise.

description: Poland also scrambled aircraft in response to fresh Russian drone strikes just over the border in Ukraine, days after an unprecedented incursion.

headline: On the border with Ukraine, Polish residents live in fear: 'When I heard that explosion, I thought, that's it, that's war'
description: In the east of the country, along the Ukrainian and Belarusian borders, where Russian drones crashed on September 10, residents live in constant fear of war.

headline: France edges past Ireland in nail-biting Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final
description: Les Bleues eventually overpowered the Irish team to win 18-13. The French will now face either England or Scotland in the semi-finals.

headline: What is the purpose of central bank independence and who does it serve?
description: By launching a harsh attack on the Federal Reserve, US President Donald Trump tried to exert control over an independent institution. But should these central banks really be left solely in the hands of experts and technicians? Economist Jézabel Couppey-Soubeyran explores the issue in her column.

description: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.

headline: Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed
description: Israeli officials have recently provided French authorities with their own assessment of the airstrikes that targeted Tehran's nuclear arsenal in June. This information is particularly valuable to France after American intelligence agencies have halted all cooperation with their European partners regarding the Iranian nuclear program.

headline: Economist Gabriel Zucman: 'France's new PM will have to address the proposed tax on the ultra-rich'
description: Zucman is the architect behind the proposal to tax the wealthiest individuals, a measure championed by the left. 'It will be very difficult to ask the French people to make sacrifices as long as billionaires pay so little in taxes,' he told Le Monde in an interview.
